reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner booked this hotel for a weekend visit to London. As other's comment the hotel looks nothing from the exterior We were welcomed with a friendly greeting from the receptionist. Our room 212 was spotlessly clean a little small but perfectly acceptable. The bathroom again was spotlessly clean and well appointed with a lovely shower which feels like a power shower. The bed is very comfy. One word of warning to the ladies, the hairdryer in the room did not work and even though the receptionist gave me access to another room to try theirs that one did not work either! The breakfast is basic but acceptable. The best thing about the hotel is the location, 100 yards to the Oval tube, on the Northern line only 5 stops from Leicester Square, so you are in central London in 10 minutes. A great value hotel. We will definitely use again.
reviews.title: Great Value,Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: We needed comfortable, quiet, affordable accommodation near to the Oval, and there aren’t many options available - but the Belgrave suited us very well.
reviews.title: A really good affordable hotel

likes.liked: — Clean, quiet, excellent value - plus lovely staff
likes.disliked: — Breakfast & breakfast area a bit disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is situated within a few minutes walk of the Oval tube station. The exterior is, shall we say, unpretentious; the interior is a lot smarter.
reviews.title: A great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked online, and check-in was quick and stress-free. I have to say that all the staff we encountered were charming, helpful and friendly - and very efficient.
reviews.title: Horrible experience will never return

likes.liked: — I did not like a single thing about this cave
likes.disliked: — The rude staff, very very rude staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was not enormous, but did not feel cramped. It was spotlessly clean, and comfortably and intelligently furnished and equipped - crisp white bed linen, wool carpet, good mirrors and fittings, lined curtains, flat-screen TV, safe, tea & coffee making facilities, hairdryer etc. We had a full bathroom, attractively tiled, with a shower over the bath, huge fluffy white towels, dispensers of shower gel and handwash.
reviews.title: It was OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Was very pleasantly suprised. Overall an excellent over night stay ,clean , warm , and freindly service most welcoming.The rooms are not massive but reasonable and with SKYSPORTS 1 2 Clean and warm interior the feelings good. The hotel staff very helpfull . Didnt have to wait to get in at the front door in the early hours of New years day 2012. Parking at the back of HOTEL bit of a small area but was exceptable and convienent concidering the time i had to find else were would of possibly cost more and taken time to find being new to the area. The showers are lovely ,no water coming on to the floor like some hotel rooms wich is a pain especially when you get dressed and your soaks get wet when you keep goin in the bathroom to spruce youre self up on occassions to get ready for youre night out. The beds were very very comfy lots of spring in them very pleasnat nights sleep.Some beds can be a bit to solid.. The central heating i put on in the room was put on immediately as the hotel bedroom window was open and there was a bit of a chill in the room. The room soon heated up and in the middle of the night had to turn it of as the room was very warm . Good for a winters night most pleasing. When we awoke i realised Breakfast was served untill 10:30am and we didnt depart our room untill 11:30am as it was new years day and had a late night. On our way to the car to put my beloning back for our return journey home the Hotel Manager very well spoken ask us if we had enjoyed our stay and if we had had breakfast. Wich we oviuosly answerd no bit of a late one last night. He then kindly escorted us to a small and clean dining area and seated us and said it would be ok to have breakfast ,coffee , tea and frshly squeezed orange juice , cereals.. fruit.. We were delighted to say the least and and soon sat down and enduldged in a tasty Fry up and Bacon,Sausage,Mushroom, etc . Coffe tea orange juice what a star.. Our stay here was NONE SHORT OF Excellenct Customer Servive and warm very clean and helpfull polite staff wich in my books is all you need for a great stay.Recommend here to any one who is wanting comfort and nice chilling time..
reviews.title: Nye 2011-2012

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for NYE and somewhere to crash after a night at Brixton Academy. It's close to Brixton and literally a 2 minute walk from Oval Tube Station.
reviews.title: Nice & simple for the weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The outside looks a bit shabby, but inside it's clean, safe and everything you need. There's a bed, a toilet and a shower. That's all we needed for the night! Would definitely return.
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Very reasonable price for London, especially NYE!
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing I would say is the hotel needs a bar!
reviews.title: A gem!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The space in front of the hotel is so untidy that my husband was very doubtful about going in! This is a shame as inside is immaculately clean.
reviews.title: please tidy front garden

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The 2 staff we saw were very smiley.The quality of the linen is the same as in a very expensive boutique style hotel,
reviews.title: great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: It is a bit of a shame that the worst review 'Faulty towers' does not refer to this hotel but to one in Victoria. This one suited our needs and other people we know would stay there if it did not look so bad from the outside. Also what other reviwers say about breakfast is very true.
reviews.title: The worst hotel I have ever stayed in! Don't stay here..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: five of us stayed here on the night before we took part in the London to Brighton Bike ride. The hotel is about a 15minute cycle ride to Clapham Common; the staff could not have been more helpful and helped us get the bikes into secure storage (including a tandem) they even had someone on hand at 5am to fix breakfast for us. The rooms and the linen were all clean, the showers worked and it's really easy to find with good access by tube and bus to the centre of London (Oval tube is across the road), I am not easily pleased but this hotel was ideal
reviews.title: Oh dear!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I booked a one night stay with my Partner as we needed to be near the Oval last year. It is quite frankly the worst hotel I have ever stayed in in London. The rooms were small with a bed that dipped downwards, the bathroom flooded and the noise outside from traffic and the planes (every minute) drove me crazy. The breakfast was minimal! I asked for an iron that they did eventually bring up to the room but it nearly ruined the shirt. To top it off I paid £100 for the room, and then an extra £10.00 to park my car in the so called car park, which looked like a junk yard. My car drove over hump on the entrance to the car park and I was suprised it did not ruin the car!. There are much better hotels than this for your money. It is not worth £100 per night. Go somewhere else!
reviews.title: Helpful until you have paid!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012
reviews.text: Very pleasant stay. The location - near the Oval - was perfect for us but handy for central London as well.
reviews.title: Good alternative to the chains

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The room was of a reasonable size and well kept. My one negative comment is that the windows and frames are grubby.
reviews.title: Good value - I'm back for my third week

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Otherwise - recommended.
reviews.title: Delivers on it's promises

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel purely on location - my customr is nearby, but I've just booked my third week there. No frills, but what they offer works. The rooms at the back are quieter than the front, and the aircraft can be noisey, but then anywhere in that part of london would suffer the same.
reviews.title: A Very Good basic hotel offering value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Oval Lounge directly across the road is a nice place to eat, but it's menu doesn;t change often!
reviews.title: Convenient location, clean and friendly staff
